casebody.data:
Norfleet & Jordan vs. Vaughn et al. JACKSON, Chief Justice.

The verdict in th's case is supported by the evidence.

(al) If the original breaking and entering of one’s close be wrongful, the retention of the property thereafter is also wrongful, and consequential damages are recoverable therefor; certainly so to the time of filing the writ, if not up to the time of the verdict. Fuchter vs. Boehm, Bendheim Co., 67 Ga., 534.
